# this file and re-run i3-config-wizard(1).

# i3 config file (v4)

# Please see https://i3wm.org/docs/userguide.html for a complete reference!

set $mod Mod4

# Use pactl to adjust volume in PulseAudio.
#set $refresh_i3status killall -SIGUSR1 i3status
#bindsym XF86AudioRaiseVolume exec --no-startup-id pactl set-sink-volume @DEFAULT_SINK@ +5% && $refresh_i3status
#bindsym XF86AudioLowerVolume exec --no-startup-id pactl set-sink-volume @DEFAULT_SINK@ -5% && $refresh_i3status
#bindsym XF86AudioMute exec --no-startup-id pactl set-sink-mute @DEFAULT_SINK@ toggle && $refresh_i3status
#bindsym XF86AudioMicMute exec --no-startup-id pactl set-source-mute @DEFAULT_SOURCE@ toggle && $refresh_i3status

# Use Mouse+$mod to drag floating windows to their wanted position
floating_modifier $mod

# start a terminal
#bindsym $mod+Return exec "alacritty -e tmux -c 'uwufetch'"
#bindsym $mod+Return exec "kitty -e ~/.config/tmux/startup.sh" # So close!
#bindsym $mod+Return exec "cear && pfetch
#/.config/tmux/startup.sh" # So close!
#bindsym $mod+Return exec "kitty -e tmux"
bindsym $mod+Return exec "kitty"

# Open file manager
# Now i use yazi
#bindsym $mod+Shift+Return exec "nautilus"

# take screenshot with ksnip and move it to ~/Pictures/Screenshots
#bindsym $mod+Shift+p exec $HOME/.config/i3/takeScreenshot.sh

# adjust brightness -- req chmod of brightness file
#bindsym XF86MonBrightnessUp exec "xbacklight -inc 25"
#bindsym XF86MonBrightnessUp exec "kitty"
#bindsym XF86MonBrightnessDown exec "xbacklight -dec 25"

# Controll sys76 gpu state
#bindsym $mod+Shift+t exec "i3-nagbar -t warning -m 'Choose a graphics state:' -b 'Power Down GPU' 'system76-power graphics power off && killall i3-nagbar' -b 'Compute' 'system76-power graphics compute && killall i3-nagbar' -b 'Hybrid' 'system76-power graphics hybrid && killall i3-nagbar' -b 'Nvidia' 'system76-power graphics nvidia && killall i3-nagbar' -b 'Integrated' 'system76-power graphics integrated && killall i3-nagbar'"

# kill focused window
bindsym $mod+Shift+q kill

# start xscreensaver
#exec_always xscreensaver --no-splash

# start dmenu (a program launcher)
#bindsym $mod+d exec --no-startup-id dmenu_run
bindsym $mod+d exec --no-startup-id "rofi -show drun"
bindsym $mod+Shift+d exec --no-startup-id "rofi -show run"


# TODO: Okay so this works but the && are causing issues, where the pue is included in the left half
# TODO: Good luck I guess :p
# Start keepassxc in the void, and connect to wifi
# This is super scuffed I'm sorry
exec pueue group add -p 2 swayKeepassShenanagains
exec pueue pause -g swayKeepassShenanagains
exec pueue add -p 6 -g swayKeepassShenanagains swaymsg "workspace 11"
exec pueue add -p 5 -g swayKeepassShenanagains ${pkgs.keepassxc}/bin/keepassxc /home/juliet/Keyring-Tetrahedron.kdbx --keyfile /home/juliet/Keyring-Tetrahedron.key
exec pueue add -p 4 -g swayKeepassShenanagains ${pkgs.bash}/bin/bash sleep 1
exec pueue add -p 3 -g swayKeepassShenanagains ${pkgs.nm-applet}/bin/nm-applet
exec pueue add -p 2 -g swayKeepassShenanagains ${pkgs.bash}/bin/bash sleep 1
exec pueue add -p 1 -g swayKeepassShenanagains swaymsg "workspace 1"
exec pueue start -g swayKeepassShenanagains

# Launch clipcat in rofi, like with win+v on windows :p
# Clipcat is started by systemd
#exec_always --no-startup-id clipcatd
#bindsym $mod+v exec clipcat-menu

# A more modern dmenu replacement is rofi:
# bindcode $mod+40 exec "rofi -modi drun,run -show drun"
# There also is i3-dmenu-desktop which only displays applications shipping a
# .desktop file. It is a wrapper around dmenu, so you need that installed.
# bindcode $mod+40 exec --no-startup-id i3-dmenu-desktop

# class                 border  bground text    indicator child_border
client.focused          #458588 #458588 #FFFFFF #689D6A   #458588
client.focused_inactive #83a598 #83a598 #FFFFFF #458588   #5F676A00
client.unfocused        #458588 #83a598 #FFFFFF #292D2E   #2222f200
client.urgent           #FB4934 #CC241D #FFFFFF #CC241D   #CC241D
client.placeholder      #000000 #0C0C0C #FFFFFF #000000   #0C0C0C

client.background       #FFFFFF

# Set border size
default_border pixel 1

#Doesnt appear to do anything?
default_floating_border pixel 1

gaps inner 4
gaps outer -5
smart_gaps on
smart_borders on
#gaps outer current plus 5
#gaps horizontal current plus 40
#gaps outer current toggle 60

# change focus
bindsym $mod+h focus left
bindsym $mod+j focus down
bindsym $mod+k focus up
bindsym $mod+l focus right

# move focused window
bindsym $mod+Shift+h move left 15 px
bindsym $mod+Shift+j move down 15 px
bindsym $mod+Shift+k move up 15 px
bindsym $mod+Shift+l move right 15 px

# split in horizontal orientation
#bindsym $mod+h split n

# enter fullscreen mode for the focused container
bindsym $mod+f fullscreen toggle

# change container layout (stacked, tabbed, toggle split)
bindsym $mod+s layout stacking
bindsym $mod+w layout tabbed
bindsym $mod+e layout toggle split

# toggle tiling / floating
bindsym $mod+Shift+space floating toggle

# change focus between tiling / floating windows
bindsym $mod+space focus mode_toggle

# focus the parent container
bindsym $mod+a focus parent

# focus the child container
bindsym $mod+Shift+a focus child

# Define names for default workspaces for which we configure key bindings later on.
# We use variables to avoid repeating the names in multiple places.
set $ws1 "1"
set $ws2 "2"
set $ws3 "3"
set $ws4 "4"
set $ws5 "5"
set $ws6 "6"
set $ws7 "7"
set $ws8 "8"
set $ws9 "9"
set $ws10 "10"
# The void: Used to store programs I think should be headless/run in background
# Todo: needs to be renamed to 'V' or 'Void', from 11, but idk how to do that in i3
set $ws11 "11"

# switch to workspace
bindsym $mod+1 workspace number $ws1
bindsym $mod+2 workspace number $ws2
bindsym $mod+3 workspace number $ws3
bindsym $mod+4 workspace number $ws4
bindsym $mod+5 workspace number $ws5
bindsym $mod+6 workspace number $ws6
bindsym $mod+7 workspace number $ws7
bindsym $mod+8 workspace number $ws8
bindsym $mod+9 workspace number $ws9
bindsym $mod+0 workspace number $ws10
bindsym $mod+Ctrl+v workspace number $ws11

# move focused container to workspace
bindsym $mod+Shift+1 move container to workspace number $ws1
bindsym $mod+Shift+2 move container to workspace number $ws2
bindsym $mod+Shift+3 move container to workspace number $ws3
bindsym $mod+Shift+4 move container to workspace number $ws4
bindsym $mod+Shift+5 move container to workspace number $ws5
bindsym $mod+Shift+6 move container to workspace number $ws6
bindsym $mod+Shift+7 move container to workspace number $ws7
bindsym $mod+Shift+8 move container to workspace number $ws8
bindsym $mod+Shift+9 move container to workspace number $ws9
bindsym $mod+Shift+0 move container to workspace number $ws10
bindsym $mod+Shift+v move container to workspace number $ws11

# reload the configuration file
bindsym $mod+Shift+c reload
# restart i3 inplace (preserves your layout/session, can be used to upgrade i3)
bindsym $mod+Shift+r restart
# exit i3 (logs you out of your X session)
#bindsym $mod+Shift+e exec "i3-nagbar -t warning -m 'You pressed the exit shortcut. Do you really want to exit i3? This will end your X session.' -B 'Yes, exit i3' 'i3-msg exit'"
bindsym $mod+Shift+e exec "i3-nagbar -t warning -m 'Poweroff Options:' -B 'Poweroff' 'systemctl poweroff & killall i3-nagbar' -B 'Yes, exit i3' 'i3-msg exit' -B 'Suspend' 'systemctl suspend & killall i3-nagbar' -B 'Lock' 'xscreensaver-command -lock'"

# resize window (you can also use the mouse for that)
mode "resize" {
        # These bindings trigger as soon as you enter the resize mode

        bindsym h resize shrink width 5 px
        bindsym j resize grow height 5 px
        bindsym k resize shrink height 5 px
        bindsym l resize grow width 5 px
        bindsym $mod+h resize shrink width 15 px
        bindsym $mod+j resize grow height 15 px
        bindsym $mod+k resize shrink height 15 px
        bindsym $mod+l resize grow width 15 px

        # back to normal: Enter or Escape or $mod+r
        bindsym Return mode "default"
        bindsym Escape mode "default"
        bindsym $mod+r mode "default"

        bindsym $mod+Shift+space floating toggle

        # move focused window
        bindsym $mod+Shift+h move left 5 px
        bindsym $mod+Shift+j move down 5 px
        bindsym $mod+Shift+k move up 5 px
        bindsym $mod+Shift+l move right 5 px
        bindsym Shift+h move left 2 px
        bindsym Shift+j move down 2 px
        bindsym Shift+k move up 2 px
        bindsym Shift+l move right 2 px
}

bindsym $mod+r mode "resize"

# Start i3bar to display a workspace bar (plus the system information i3status
# finds out, if available)
#bar {
#        status_command i3status
#}
